title: TS-0525 Shoppers Stop :: Darwinbox - this is to update the biometric data for them for payroll and performance purpose Integration BRD

detailsTable.Status: IN REVIEW [DRAFT / IN REVIEW / APPROVED / IN PRODUCTION]

Purpose/Justification.content:
*   This document outlines the business requirements and technical details associated with the API-based inbound integration between Shoppers Stop and Darwinbox, as defined by both Shoppers Stop and the Darwinbox Integrations team.
*   The purpose of this integration is to facilitate the transfer of employee biometric attendance data from Shoppers Stop to Darwinbox for accurate payroll processing and performance management.

Integration Description and Overview.content:
**Integration Description and Overview**
*   This is an API-based inbound integration between Shoppers Stop and Darwinbox.
*   Shoppers Stop will consume Darwinbox APIs to push employee biometric data updates.
*   The integration's scope covers updating biometric data for payroll and performance purposes.
*   The integration will support an employee strength of 10,000, with a maximum of 100,000 attendance punches pushed daily.
*   This integration focuses on the Attendance module within Darwinbox.
**API-Based Approach**
*   Shoppers Stop will use Darwinbox's APIs to transmit biometric data.

Assumptions.content:
**Assumptions**
*   Shoppers Stop will provide accurate and complete employee biometric data.
*   Shoppers Stop will ensure the data format adheres to Darwinbox API specifications.
*   All employee IDs provided by Shoppers Stop exist within Darwinbox.
*   Shoppers Stop will handle data mapping and transformation to Darwinbox's required format.
*   Shoppers Stop will manage error handling and retry mechanisms on their end.
*   Darwinbox API uptime will be consistent and reliable.
*   Darwinbox API performance will be sufficient to handle the expected volume of requests.
*   Shoppers Stop will adhere to the agreed-upon API rate limits.
*   Employee shift, policy, and week-off assignments are configured in Darwinbox prior to attendance data push.
*   Shoppers Stop will provide attendance punches within the configured buffer limit in Darwinbox.

Dependencies.content:
- Darwinbox API access must be provisioned for Shoppers Stop.
- Shoppers Stop must be provided with the API endpoint details for attendance punches.
- Authentication credentials (API keys, tokens, etc.) must be securely exchanged between Darwinbox and Shoppers Stop.
- The HCM module (Attendance policy, attendance shift, Clock-in Priority and weekly off) must be fully configured as per the configuration workbook.
- Data validation rules must be defined and implemented on the Darwinbox side to ensure data integrity.
- Shoppers Stop must adhere to the defined API rate limits to prevent service disruption.
- Shoppers Stop must provide a mechanism for error logging and reporting.
- Darwinbox's API documentation must be provided to Shoppers Stop.
